<@UBT0AHWLD> <@U2H3TT8F2> Currently, I'm using *macros for the markup* and the *module for the fields* values, to do that. Below is just a simple example. I'm  also using it in different advanced ways to share markup between global and local modules, as well as dynamic pages.

module has on field to select a page:
```  {% from '../../templates/macros/item-macro.html' import item %}
  {{ item( content_by_id(module.page) ) }}```
and _item-macro.html_ has the markup:
```  {% macro item( content ) %}
    <a href="{{ content.absolute_url }}">{{ content.name }}</a>
  {% endmacro %}```
In the case of a submodule it would extend the existing fields of a module with the submodule fields. But I'm not sure if I like this, macros seems to me the better way, even if you have to create the module-fields you need to reuse a markup-macro.
*Sorting with Umlaut would be a nice feature. Don't have to be an option, would be okay if it works out of the box.*

^^ *Not practical for other languages.* 
Words can sometimes become very long.
Then maybe some sort of icon button group with tooltip descriptions for the icon
